column1: Penis pain is any pain or discomfort in the penis.

Causes may include: - Bladder stone - Bites, either human or insect - Cancer of the penis - Erection that does not go away (priapism) - Genital herpes - Infected hair follicles - Infected prosthesis of the penis - Infection under the foreskin of uncircumcised men (balanitis) - Inflammation of the prostate gland (prostatitis) - Injury - Peyronie's disease - Reiter syndrome - Sickle cell anemia - Syphilis - Urethritis caused by chlamydia or gonorrhea
Ice packs may help ease the pain.
If penis pain is caused by a sexually transmitted disease, it is important for your sexual partner to also be treated.
Ask your provider about getting treatment for the condition causing priapism.
Treatments depend on the cause: - Infection, antibiotics, antiviral medications, or other medications (in rare cases, circumcision is advised for long-term infection under the foreskin).
